body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.): No


**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.): rollout status namespace

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): Bug Report

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.3", GitCommit:"029c3a408176b55c30846f0faedf56aae5992e9b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-02-15T06:40:50Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.2", GitCommit:"08e099554f3c31f6e6f07b448ab3ed78d0520507", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"1970-01-01T00:00:00Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Macbook Pro 2015
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Mac OSX Sierra
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`):
- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:


**What happened**:

1. Using `kubectl apply -f resource.yml`, where resource.yml does the following:
  - Describes a Deployment object
  - Sets a non-default namespace in the metadata
2. Run `kubectl rollout status -f resource.yml`. An error message says the resource was not found
3. Run `kubectl rollout status -f resource.yml -f <customNamespace>`. The response shows the status of the rollout.

**What you expected to happen**:
I expected `kubectl rollout status -f resource.yml` to work as well by using the namespace that is set inside resource.yml for the rollout status request.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
1. Run `kubectl create namespace reprns`
2. Create the following file as nginx.yml (taken from the [nginx tutorial docs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubernetes/kubernetes.github.io/master/docs/tutorials/stateless-application/deployment.yaml) but updated to add the namespace):
```
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment
  namespace: reprns
spec:
  replicas: 2 # tells deployment to run 2 pods matching the template
  template: # create pods using pod definition in this template
    metadata:
      # unlike pod-nginx.yaml, the name is not included in the meta data as a unique name is
      # generated from the deployment name
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:1.7.9
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
```
3. Run `kubectrl apply -f nginx.yml`
4. Run `kubectl rollout status -f nginx.yml`
  - Returns `Error from server (NotFound): deployments.extensions "nginx-deployment" not found`
5. Run `kubectl rollout status -f nginx.yaml -n reprns`
  - Returns `deployment "nginx-deployment" successfully rolled out`

**Anything else we need to know**:
We've seen this issue on 1.5.1 as well, and also on Ubuntu. The recreate instructions above were performed on a fresh minikube setup.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.
labels.name: lifecycle/stale

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: "kubectl rollout status -f resource.yml" doesn't use namespace from resource.yml
